name: The Fairmont Palliser

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights at the Fairmont Palliser.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I selected the gold room and I must say: the service was amazing.
reviews.title: Classic Fairmont!

reviews.text: Great staff, very friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: A lovely city Hotel

reviews.text: The concierges were amazing.
reviews.title: You probably can't do better in Calgary

reviews.text: The day I left, I even got printed directions for the next trip and a very friendly note.
reviews.title: Weekend honeymoon

reviews.text: After 2 weeks in Canada we were at the Palliser for our last night. We knew it was an old railway hotel and it still retains the grandeur of hotels round the world that were built when travelling by rail was glamerous!
reviews.title: Good choice for last night of our holiday

reviews.text: We upgraded to Gold as our holiday was to celebrate a special anniversary. The staff were wonderful. Our room was large - as was the bathroom . This is not a hotel with views - it's behind the railway but we did not notice any related noise.
reviews.title: Average Fairmont, Neighbourhood was sketchy after sunset

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the lobby bar which was very good.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not flying until the next evening and the guest director suggested a late check out for us ( we did not ask and we were not charged extra!!). We had use of the Gold lounge until we really had to go. Breakfast and evening nibbles were wonderful.
reviews.title: Not up to Fairmont expectations

likes.liked: — It was conveniently located and there is a sense of history about the hotel itself.
likes.disliked: — Level of service was not as expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Go up the Calgary Tower next door to look down on the hotel. I seems huge when you are in it but in comparison to the newer buildings surrounding it is tiny!
reviews.title: Grand accommodations

likes.liked: — service, hotel restaurant, room quality and decor

reviews.text: Nice that they had a pool and the chocolate buffet. Other than that!
reviews.title: Big mistake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was awful. Room was small, dark and dingy. Scary location, and awful staff! Totally unlike Fairmont.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed here and wouldn't recommend it. It is def overpriced and overrated. You are basically paying for the building and the name and not the actual room. Our room was average for the price, the bed was quite uncomfortable and we had a lot of noise all night long which made sleeping impossible. However the service as with all Fairmonts was excellent and the location is pretty good but for the price you can find much better in the same area. The pool wasn't anything special and the gym was decent but not worth the extra cash.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel so full of character

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights two nights in one room and a night in a double suite. Both rooms were wonderful as indeed is the experience at the hotel.
reviews.title: COULD BE A FIVE STAR WITH A LITTLE TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Palliser scores over the other hotels in Calgary because of its originality. Whilst it has all the comforts that you can expect from a Fairmont it has retained
reviews.title: Lovely Old Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a few days in Calgary, staying at the Fairmont. I had been hesitant to book because I'd read other reviews about the dated decor.. and they were right. The lobby and entrance are grand and stately, just as it must have been when it was built. However, our room did not stand up to the Fairmont reputation. I was shocked when we entered our tiny little room that looked like an old pension I slept in when I was backpacking in Europe years ago. The carpet was stained, the wallpaper faded and plain, and a bathroom so dingy I couldn't take my shoes off. The bathtub was an old almond color with matching old beige tiles, most of which had thick black mildew-stained grout from years of water exposure. Even the most weary traveller wouldn't take a bath. The edges were re-caulked with the skill of a 2 year old. The fixtures had seen their day and the overall appearance was the farthest thing from luxury I'd ever seen. The doors are paper thin, you could hear a pin drop in the hallway. The walls aren't much better, as I was woken up every morning by the next room's telephone and ensuing conversation. I also thought it was odd that there was a sheet and a duvet on the bed, but there was no duvet cover. The mattress and bed were very comfortable, which was the best thing about the room. The hotel considers the business traveler by offering in-room internet for $14 per 24 hours, most other hotels don't charge. I would say the housekeeping is good and the hotel is clean. My advise is to save your money and stay at the Hyatt wich isn't more than a block away. A great disappointment to a nice trip.
reviews.title: Terrible Rooms - Old & Gross

reviews.text: I stayed at the Palliser for six nights. And if it is all about location, this place is perfect. Shopping, restaurants and tourist attractions like the Calgary Tower are all within walking distance.
reviews.title: The Palliser needs a makeover

reviews.text: Being one of the oldest hotels in town, the Palliser has the ambience of the good old days...but the charm is fading. The public areas such as the lobby, the restaurant, the bar and the pool are well maintained. But the rooms don't live up to a five star standard...not at all.
reviews.title: Not the fairest Fairmont

reviews.text: I had a well-sized standard room with a kingsize bed, a large cabinet with tv, minibar and some drawers, small work-area with a desk and chair, coffee table with a lounge chair and a walk-in closet. The decor is 'good old days', too. The bed was very comfortable and definitely the newest item in the room. All other furniture obviously had suffered years of wear and tear. There were scratches and torn-off edges. You could see by the dust on the red carpet, that some furniture had not been moved in a long time, not even to vacuum underneath.
reviews.title: Suites Best way To Go Here

reviews.text: About the bathroom...well...I have seen better maintained bathrooms in roadside motels. No doubt, the bathroom was being cleaned, but: The wallpaper was coming off in some places. There was black mold in the shower. The plastic hooks of the shower curtain were so filthy, that I requested them to be changed. And I tend not to be picky about such things.
reviews.title: Worth every penny

likes.disliked: — View from our room, it was a brick wall.

reviews.text: This place is a historic marvel and that alone makes the stay worthwhile. The architecture in the grand lobby takes your breath away, the lounges and restaurants make you feel like you are in an old world gentlemen's club. The staff is without exception the best I've ever had the pleasure to deal with, and the room, while smaller, was handsomely appointed and the bed was the most comfy I've EVER slept in. Honestly. But there are a few things that were negatives that detract from the overall great impression you get, and can leave a bad taste in your mouth. For example, there is a bottle of water in your room - nice touch, if you weren't charged $7 to open it. WiFi is available but for a daily fee as well. These are things that should be free in this day and age, and simply saying "Please enjoy this with our compliments" would be a simple and classy touch. I was afraid to eat the mints left in our room or wear the plush bath robes for fear of being charged for them! (Okay, a little exaggeration, but still...) Overall, the hotel works its charm well and I would consider staying again for this kind of business trip.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Romantic, Classy but some drawbacks...

reviews.text: We were impressed with the "old world charm' when we first walked in. The staff was helpful and friendly. We were with a group of six and only one room was available. When we were finally led to our room, we realized that a freight train was running past our windows. We asked if it ran all day and they admitted that it was used 24 hours a day. The room was nice but we asked for a change. The only one left was a room with two beds instead of the king bed we had reserved. The furniture is no longer charming but dated. The linens were lovely, but the hotel had a drab feeling to it. Since it has no view, I think other travelers would do just as well at a new, more updated hotel in the area.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is difficult to negotiate due to traffic patterns and area construction.
reviews.title: Nice people...bad property

reviews.text: The area is convenient to downtown...but not as good as the Westin or Marriott.
reviews.title: The strangest Fairmont I've ever seen.

reviews.text: Palliser 5th floor Jr Suite next to elevator was awful...terrible bathroom designs..no space to move in the closet sized bathroom. The view of the railrood tracks and the graffiti on the back wall of the opposing building across the tracks was an added insult to a high priced room!
reviews.title: Good choice for business or pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairmont Palliser just for one night prior to our return back to the UK after our two week tour of the Rockies. Everything was booked for us through the Rocky Mountaineer and the service we received from Rocky Mountaineer was very good indeed.
reviews.title: A first rate city hotel

reviews.text: After a disappointing stay at the Banff Springs we set off on a wet and very cloudy day on the drive from Banff to Calgary.
reviews.title: High Quality Hotel in Downtown Calgary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gold conceirge staff at the Palliser had contacted me a few days before our arrival to see if they could make any reservations for us which was very helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel in heavy rain and took advantage of the Valet Parking service, which is expensive at $37 for one night but this is a city centre hotel and the car park is does not belong to the hotel. We were taken up to the Gold Floor and received a very warm greeting from the staff. The new lounge is really lovely, spacious, bright and very well stocked with delicious cookies and snacks throughout the day. The staff were also very attentive and really kept the lounge clean and tidy (this had not been the experience at Banff Springs)
reviews.title: Convenient location, high end hotel and nice updates... finally!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hadn't made dinner reservations because we thought we may eat out but the rain was so heavy we booked a table in the Rimrock Restaurant which was lovely, certainly one of my favourite restaurants of all the Fairmont hotels we ate in. The food was very good and the service impeccable. I also loved the room with the blazing fireplace, very romantic indeed.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel in Downtown, showing age a bit

reviews.text: This hotel has such beautiful character.Old CP Hotel
reviews.title: Great place to stay in downtown Calgary

reviews.text: They are doing some up grades on some floors.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at our favorite hotel in Calgary

reviews.text: Staff was excellent.Food was good.But a bit $$$
reviews.title: Not worth the Money

reviews.text: Son was married & we stayed 2nights .Japan family stayed 5 nights.
reviews.title: The nice grandeur of the Fairmont Palliser Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great for site seeing calgary
reviews.title: Go for Gold

reviews.text: In a small downtown area that is Calgary, The Fairmont Palliser is the only upper class accomodation for travelers. The hotel is about 15 minutes walking distance from the Pengrowth Saddledome, the home of the NHL Calgary Flames. The room are on the small side and the delicious buffet luncheon in pricey for those on a budgets, the charm of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff sets this property apart.
reviews.title: Only place to stay in Calgary

reviews.text: I stayed at the Fairmont Palliser this past weekend for my birthday and I couldn't have made a better choice...I booked my best rate through the Fairmont President's Club (totally worth it to get a FREE President's Club membership) and was also upgraded upon check-in. Wonderful room which even had a view of the Calgary Tower! Bathroom was a bit on the small side, but I wasn't planning on doing any twirling in there so it was more than adequate. Large front/hall closet (with light), 2 phones (one cordless), flat screen LG TV, coffee maker, electric kettle and robes. The staff discovered it was my birthday and gave me the VIP treatment (candle and sparkler in a mini-muffin at breakfast, a cheese and fruit plate delivered while I was away in Banff, card from the General Manager, etc.). And I can't even describe the Sunday Brunch...if you are there on a Sunday, do not miss...yes, it's $$$, but the selection is enormous and if they don't have something you want, your server will go have the chef make it for you. Beautiful, beautiful hotel in a great location. I would definitely stay there again!!!
reviews.title: LOVE this hotel!!!

likes.disliked: — The view wasn't the greatest and the bathroom was small

reviews.text: Stayed a Friday night before flying back to the UK after several days travelling through the Rockies from Vancouver. Arrived around half ten in the morning and was instantly greeted by the doorman who took my luggage and directed me to the car rental depot in order that I could return our car. Returned back after half an hour and checked in with no difficulty, a room was made available straight away. I had booked through the Fairmont President Club scheme and received an excellent rate of $154 for the night (including two breakfasts which alone would come to $52!). Made my way up to my room which was excellent, two double beds, desk, flat screen tv etc. Nice touch was the fact that internet access was free as a FPC member, $14 otherwise. Room was nicely decorated and clean throughout. Only downside was that there wasn't much of a view, however in fairness there isn't much a hotel can do about surrounding buildings! Luggage arrived promptly to the room and bell staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't eat dinner in the hotel as I had Flames tickets, however we had an excellent early meal at the Keg located in the Westin hotel a few blocks walk away. The following morning we had an superb buffet breakfast, service was fine and the food delicious. Regular buffet price is $26 which I personally feel is worth the money considering the selection and choice of food on offer. The decor was fine throughout, certainly didn't seem to be in need of a refurb as some people have suggested. Having stayed at other Fairmonts it seems of comparable standard. Overall nice staff, great old building, central location, absolutely no complaints!
reviews.title: Grand old hotel, good stay

reviews.text: I stayed 5 day at the Palliser. I had an upgrade certifcate part of the president club , they upgrade me to a junior suite.
reviews.title: Landmark Hotel

reviews.text: The room was quite big. I had a view of the Tower. The service is excellent, you can get free internet just by being President club member. If you like chocolate, They have a chocolate buffet Monday's night it is 26 dollars, if you order an entree it is 16 dollars. The pool, hot tub and exercice facility are very nice.
reviews.title: nice hotel..great service

likes.liked: — Lovely city hotel with enthousiastic ice hockey supporters :-)

description: Since 1914, The Fairmont Palliser has been the city's premier address, the cornerstone of Calgary's hospitality industry and a landmark building that is rich in history and architecture. Set in the heart of the city, The Fairmont Palliser is a historical landmark offering distinctive accommodation in elegant surroundings. Recent renovations include five floors of guest rooms and the expansion of Fairmont Gold. A brand new Fairmont Gold Lounge, Concierge and Check-in area can be found on the Penthouse Level.
